detail.content: CPR | Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                  Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                                                                  Home   Patient Care   Education   Research   Courses   Our People   Make a Donation                                  Home Courses Life Support CPR            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Courses        open/close   Life Support  CPR   ACLS   PALS       open/close   Emergency Radiology     open/close   Clinical Toxicology                                                                      CPR                                                      Healthcare Provider Course:   The Healthcare Provider Course is designed to teach the skills of CPR for victims of all ages (including ventilation with barrier device, bag-mask device and oxygen), use of an automated external defibrillator (AED), and relief of foreign body airway obstruction. It is intended for participants who provide healthcare to patients in a wide variety of settings, including in-hospital and out-of-hospital. For certified or non-certified, licensed or non-licensed healthcare professionals.   Audience:  Health Care Providers - Physicians, Physicians Assistants, Nurse Practitioners, Nurses, Repiratory Therapists, EMS personnel.   The Healthcare Provider Re-certification Course   Reviews all material from the Health Care Provider Course.   Requirements:  Valid Health Care Provider Card   Note: Students who present an expired Provider card or do not possess a Provider may challenge a renewal course but may not be given the option of remediation. They will need to repeat the entire Provider Course (at their own expense) if they cannot successfully meet the course completion requirements when evaluated.   CPR Renewal Online:   Designed for Healthcare Providers who have had prior CPR Training and need recertification. For more information download attached brochure .   Heartsaver Automated External Defibrillator (AED):   Adult/Child Heartsaver AED: The Heartsaver AED Course teaches the basic techniques of adult and child CPR and use of an AED. Students also learn about using barrier devices in CPR and giving first aid for choking. The course teaches how to recognize the four signs of major emergencies, heart attack, stroke, cardiac arrest, and foreign-body airway obstruction.   Audience: Lay persons, Personal Fitness Trainers, Childcare workers, Parents, Grandparents, Teachers, Employees of interested businesses or organizations.   Requirements: None   To register for either course please download and print the appropriate registration form:  CPR Registration Form or  Health Care Provider Online Skills Check Form  (requires Adobe   Reader ). Please read the cancelation and rescheduling policies.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

ACLS | Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                  Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                                                                  Home   Patient Care   Education   Research   Courses   Our People   Make a Donation                                  Home Courses Life Support ACLS            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Courses        open/close   Life Support  CPR   ACLS   PALS       open/close   Emergency Radiology     open/close   Clinical Toxicology                                                                      ACLS                                                      ACLS Provider Course:   The Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) course is designed to provide the knowledge and skills needed to evaluate and manage the first ten minutes of an adult ventricular fibrilation or ventricular tachycardia (VF/VT) arrest.   Requirements: Current CPR Health Care Provider Card (must present this with your registration form, in person or copy).    ACLS Re-certification Course:   The ACLS Recertification course reviews all of the material in the ACLS Provider course.    Requirements: Current ACLS Provider Card (must present this with your registration form, in person or copy). Current CPR Health Care Provider Card (you must present this with your registration form, in person or copy).   To register please download and print the  registration form (requires   Adobe Reader ). Please read the cancellation and rescheduling policies.   ACLS Renewal Online:   This self-directed eLearning program serves as renewal certification for ACLS. The cognitive portion ( Part 1 ) consists of online lessons, micro-simulation scenarios with feedback, and exam to test required knowledge. Skills practice ( Part 2 ) and skills test ( Part 3 ) with an AHA instructor or manikin system completes the certification process.   To register please download and print the registration form (requires Adobe Reader ). Please read the cancellation and rescheduling policies.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

PALS | Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                  Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Ronald O. Perelman Department of Emergency Medicine                                                                                  Home   Patient Care   Education   Research   Courses   Our People   Make a Donation                                  Home Courses Life Support PALS            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Courses        open/close   Life Support  CPR   ACLS   PALS       open/close   Emergency Radiology     open/close   Clinical Toxicology                                                                      PALS                                                      PALS Provider Course:   The Pediatric Advanced Life Support course is designed to provide the learner with: (1) information needed to recognize infants and children at risk for cardiopulmonary arrest, (2) information and strategies needed to prevent cardiopulmonary arrest in infants and children, and (3) the cognitive and psychomotor skills needed to resuscitate and stabilize infants and children in respiratory failure, shock or cardiopulmonary arrest.   Recommended: Current CPR Health Care Provider Card   PALS Recertification Course:   The PALS Recertification Course reviews all the material in the PALS provider course.   Requirements: Current PALS Provider Card (you must present this with your registration form, in person or copy). Current CPR Health Care Provider Card (you must present this with your registration form, in person or copy).   To register please download and print the  registration form (requires   Adobe Reader ). Please read the cancellation and rescheduling policies.   PALS Renewal Online:   This self-directed eLearning program serves as renewal certification for PALS. The cognitive portion ( Part 1 ) consists of online lessons, micro-simulation scenarios with feedback, and exam to test required knowledge. Skills practice ( Part 2 ) and skills test ( Part 3 ) with an AHA instructor or manikin system completes the certification process.   To register please download and print the registration form . Please read the cancellation and rescheduling policies.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
